sentences.sContent: The woman tried to fight down a feeling of repugnance to speak to her ex-husband.
sentences.sContent_eng: The woman tried to fight down a feeling of repugnance to speak to her ex-husband.
sentences.sCn: 那女人努力抑制反感来跟她前夫说话。

sentences.sContent: To die is only to be as we were born; yet no one feels any remorse, or regret, or repugnance, in contemplating this last idea.
sentences.sContent_eng: To die is only to be as we were born; yet no one feels any remorse, or regret, or repugnance, in contemplating this last idea.
sentences.sCn: 死亡只是恢复诞生前的原状而已；在想到诞生前的情形时，我们都毫无悔恨、遗憾、或厌恶之感。

trans.tranOther: a strong feeling of dislike for something
